data.title: Strings Manipulation
data.description: Strings are sequences of characters used to represent text. JavaScript provides many methods to manipulate strings:

manipulation.title: Characters Access
manipulation.description: You can access a specific character in a string using bracket notation: 'string[index]'.

manipulation.title: Concatenation
manipulation.description: You can combine strings using the '+' operator or the 'concat()' function.

items.description: returns the first position at which a specified substring appears.
checks if the string contains a specific substring.

manipulation.title: Slice and Extract
manipulation.description: extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.

manipulation.title: Transform
manipulation.description: convert a string to uppercase or lowercase, respectively.
